column1: However, it is also contended by the learned Counsel appearing for the 1st, 2nd and 3rd
Respondents that the decisions pertaining to arrests or prosecutions are taken not by the
said officers, acting on their own accord, but acting as the officers and employees of the
Petitionersâ€™ allegation that the 1st and 2nd Respondents acting ultra vires of their powers
were attempting to arrest the 1st and 2nd Petitioners is not tenable. It is further contended
that in such a situation, the allegations should be against the 3rd Respondent who is not
amenable to the Writ jurisdiction of the Court.
